description: This weapon displays the assymetrically placed tang and the strongly crested head of a bird that was a ubiquitous motif in the bronze art of Yin time. The bird's head, and the socket fitted with a blade of jade, are inlaid with turquoise. The meaning of the two holes in the blade is obscure. Patina green.
medium: Green jade with brown markings and bronze with green crystal inlay
title: Ko (Dagger Axe)
